content: The Act titled "Outer Continental Shelf Natural Gas Relief Act" terminates prohibitions on expenditures for and withdrawals from offshore gas leasing. The "Outer Continental Shelf Natural Gas Relief Act" ends prohibitions on spending for offshore gas leasing and revokes withdrawals of federal submerged lands for leasing purposes. SEC. 10. STATE APPROVAL REQUIREMENT WITH RESPECT TO GAS LEASING. The Secretary cannot grant gas leases within 20 miles of a state's coastline without the Governor's approval. Additionally, at least 75 percent of lease sales in each 5-year program must be for gas leasing. The amendment to the Outer Continental Shelf Lands Act requires the Secretary to include lease sales offering at least 75 percent of available unleased acreage for gas leasing in each 5-year program. This applies to the current program and all future ones. The amendment to the Outer Continental Shelf Lands Act requires the Secretary to include lease sales offering at least 75 percent of available unleased acreage for gas leasing in each 5-year program, including the current program and all future ones. This is in relation to sharing of revenues. The Outer Continental Shelf Lands Act amendment mandates offering 75% of unleased acreage for gas leasing in each 5-year program, including current and future ones, to share revenues. The Natural Gas Relief Act establishes State seaward boundaries under the Outer Continental Shelf Lands Act by extending lines indicated on maps for each outer Continental Shelf region. SEC. 5. NATURAL GAS-ONLY LEASING. Section 8 of the Outer Continental Shelf Lands Act is amended to allow the Secretary to issue leases for the development and production of natural gas and associated condensate. Regulations must be established to define natural gas, condensate, and oil, as well as the lessee's rights and obligations. Before issuing any lease for natural gas and associated condensate, the Secretary must define these substances, establish lessee rights and obligations regarding condensate, and outline procedures for handling oil deposits discovered during exploration or development. The Secretary must define natural gas and condensate, establish lessee rights, outline procedures for handling oil deposits, and set requirements for natural gas-only leases on the outer Continental Shelf. The Secretary will establish requirements for natural gas-only leases on the outer Continental Shelf, with all applicable laws and regulations also applying to these leases. The Secretary may restrict development of existing oil and gas leases to natural gas and associated condensate only upon request of the lessee. Additionally, the Secretary is authorized to issue natural gas-only leases before June 30, 2007 under specific conditions. The Secretary may restrict development under a lease to natural gas and associated condensate only, and issue natural gas-only leases before June 30, 2007 under specific conditions. The Secretary may include provisions for natural gas-only leases in the outer Continental shelf leasing program for the 5-year period starting in 2007, with public notice and comment required.
